entry.description: medication or other intervention that inhibits anxiety
entry.name: anxiolytic

entry.description: class of psychoactive drugs whose primary function is to induce sleep and to be used in the treatment of insomnia (sleeplessness), or for surgical anesthesia.
entry.name: hypnotic

entry.description: mixture used to produce a pleasant smell
entry.name: perfume

entry.description: substances used to enhance the appearance or odor of the human body
entry.name: cosmetics

entry.description: financial instrument whose value is based on one or more underlying assets
entry.name: derivative

entry.description: antimicrobial agent that is applied to non-living objects (compare: antisepsis) to reduce the number of microorganisms (unwanted germs and parasites) on them (compare:sterilization)
entry.name: disinfectant

entry.description: class of medications
entry.name: antispasmodic

entry.description: substance used to destroy pests
entry.name: pesticide

entry.description: pharmaceutical drug used primarily for the treatment of hypertension (elevated blood pressure) and congestive heart failure
entry.name: ACE inhibitor

entry.description: substance exerted in the groin or armpits to lessen the smell of body odour
entry.name: deodorant

entry.description: drug that binds to but does not activate histamine receptors, thereby blocking the actions of histamine or histamine agonists
entry.name: histamine antagonist

entry.description: agent that kills members of the arachnid subclass Acari
entry.name: acaricide

entry.description: several medications that disrupt the movement of calcium (Ca2+) through calcium channels
entry.name: calcium channel blocker

entry.description: protein exotoxin released by a microorganism that targets the intestines
entry.name: enterotoxin

entry.description: substance used in herbal medicine to promote homeostasis
entry.name: adaptogen

entry.description: Any pharmacological or immunological agent that modifies or enhances the effect of other agents such as drugs or vaccines while having few if any direct effects when given by itself.
entry.name: adjuvant

entry.description: Nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drugs (NSAID)
entry.name: COX-2 inhibitor

entry.description: chemical compound that tends to shrink or constrict body tissues
entry.name: astringent

entry.description: substance poisonous or destructive to nerve tissue
entry.name: neurotoxin

entry.description: a pharmaceutical drug that suppresses the physiologic response to tumor necrosis factor (TNF)
entry.name: TNF inhibitor

entry.description: substance that promotes hemostasis
entry.name: antihemorrhagic

entry.description: Immunomodulators are the active agents of immunotherapy. They are a diverse array of recombinant, synthetic, and natural preparations.
entry.name: immunomodulator

entry.description: herb or preparation intended to either prevent formation of gas in the gastrointestinal tract or facilitate the expulsion of said gas, thereby combatting flatulence
entry.name: carminative

entry.description: A chemical substance that encourages a cell to commence cell division, triggering mitosis.
entry.name: mitogen

entry.description: drug that induces tranquility in an individual
entry.name: tranquilizer

entry.description: drug or endogenous compound that lowers neurotransmission levels
entry.name: depressant

entry.description: relative preservation of neuronal structure and function
entry.name: neuroprotection

entry.description: An agent that renders the skin susceptible to damage (as sunburn or blisters) upon exposure to light and especially ultraviolet light.
entry.name: Phototoxicity

entry.description: group of physiologically active lipid compounds
entry.name: prostaglandins

entry.description: overarching term covers many drugs that increase activity of the central nervous system
entry.name: stimulant

entry.description: Chemical agents or odorants that stimulate sexual desires.
entry.name: aphrodisiac

entry.description: chemical substances that prevent or reduce coagulation of blood, prolonging the clotting time.
entry.name: anticoagulant

entry.description: Agents that produce a soft formed stool, and relax and loosen the bowels, typically used over a protracted period, to relieve constipation
entry.name: laxative

entry.description: biological or chemical agent that stops bacteria from reproducing, while not necessarily killing them otherwise
entry.name: bacteriostatic agent

entry.description: The quality of being toxic to cells
entry.name: cytotoxicity

entry.description: agent that suppresses immune function by one of several mechanisms of action (e.g. inhibiting DNA synthesis, inhibiting activation of T-cells, or inhibiting the activation of helper cells)
entry.name: immunosuppressive drug

entry.description: substance which neutralizes stomach acidity, used to relieve heartburn, indigestion or an upset stomach
entry.name: antacid

entry.description: antimicrobial substance
entry.name: antiseptic

entry.description: A photocarcinogen is a substance which causes cancer when an organism is exposed to it, then illuminated
entry.name: Photocarcinogen

entry.description: compound that inhibits the action of prostaglandins
entry.name: prostaglandin antagonist

entry.description: EC 2.7.* (P-containing group transferase) inhibitor that interferes with the action of protein kinases
entry.name: protein kinase inhibitors

entry.description: Schistosomiasis, also known as snail fever and bilharzia,[9] is a disease caused by parasitic flatworms called schistosomes.
entry.name: Schistosomicide

entry.description: substance that induces labor and stimulates childbirth and delivery
entry.name: Uterotonic

entry.description: agent that reduce the frequency or rate of spontaneous or induced mutations independently of the mechanism involved
entry.name: Antimutagen

entry.description: drug class
entry.name: 5-lipoxygenase inhibitor

entry.description: Histaminergic means "working on the histamine system", and histaminic means "related to histamine". A histaminergic agent (or drug) is a chemical which functions to directly modulate the histamine system in the body or brain.
entry.name: histaminergic

entry.description: Affecting GABA systems
entry.name: GABAergic

entry.description: molecule that produces a chemical change in another molecule in a photochemical process
entry.name: photosensitizer

entry.description: organic compound
entry.name: Antifeedant

entry.description: substance that kills or slows the growth of microorganisms, including bacteria, viruses, fungi and protozoans
entry.name: antimicrobial agent

entry.description: class of medications
entry.name: antiviral drug

entry.description: Hemotoxins, haemotoxins or hematotoxins are toxins that destroy red blood cells, disrupt blood clotting, and/or cause organ degeneration and generalized tissue damage
entry.name: Hemotoxin

entry.description: class of psychoactive drugs
entry.name: Deliriant

entry.description: pesticide against molluscs, which are usually used in agriculture or gardening, in order to control gastropod pests specifically slugs and snails which damage crops or other valued plants by feeding on them
entry.name: molluscicide

entry.description: A substance that augments, stimulates, activates, potentiates, or modulates the immune response at either the cellular or humoral level.
entry.name: immunostimulant

entry.description: substance that increase the volume of secretion of bile from the liver
entry.name: Choleretic

entry.description: A food preservative that acts by chelating with metal cations (particularly those of copper, iron and nickel) that catalyse the oxidation of fats in food.
entry.name: sequestrant

entry.description: pesticide used to kill plant-parasitic nematodes
entry.name: nematicide

entry.description: hygroscopic substance used to keep things moist. A humectant that is used as a food additive to prevent foodstuffs from drying out.
entry.name: humectant

entry.description: substance used to impart colour to another substance or object
entry.name: colourant

entry.description: substance that dilates the bronchi and bronchioles, decreasing resistance in the respiratory airway and increasing airflow to the lungs
entry.name: bronchodilator

entry.description: pharmaceuticals used in the treatment of high levels of fats in the blood
entry.name: hypolipidemic

entry.description: use of chemical compounds to prevent the development of a specific disease
entry.name: chemoprophylaxis

entry.description: drug or chemical that affects skeletal muscle function, decreases muscle tone
entry.name: muscle relaxant

entry.description: substance which repels insects
entry.name: insect repellent

entry.description: medical condition
entry.name: hepatotoxicity

entry.description: An agent that aids in the clearance of mucus from the airways, lungs, bronchi, and trachea.
entry.name: Mucokinetic

entry.description: toxic effect on the kidneys
entry.name: nephrotoxicity

entry.description: series of events that restore integrity to a damaged tissue, following an injury
entry.name: wound healing

entry.description: Pungency is the condition of having a strong, sharp smell or flavor that is often so strong that it is unpleasant
entry.name: pungency

entry.description: drug to relieve nasal congestion
entry.name: decongestant

entry.description: drug that softens, separates, and causes desquamation of the cornified epithelium or horny layer of skin
entry.name: keratolytic

entry.description: substance that quells or blunts the libido
entry.name: anaphrodisiac

entry.description: contraceptive substance that destroys sperm
entry.name: spermicide

entry.description: agents used in the treatment of malaria
entry.name: antimalarial

entry.description: an insecticide that is specifically targeted against the larval life stage of an insect. Their most common use is against mosquitoes. Larvicides may be contact poisons, stomach poisons, growth regulators, or (increasingly) biological control agents.
entry.name: larvicide

entry.description: drug which reduces appetite
entry.name: anorectic

entry.description: substance intended to kill helminths (parasitic worms)
entry.name: anthelmintic

entry.description: Substances which lower blood glucose levels
entry.name: anti-diabetic medication

entry.description: drug used to prevent nausea or vomiting
entry.name: antiemetic

entry.description: agent that prevents fibrinolysis or lysis of a blood clot or thrombus
entry.name: antifibrinolytic

entry.description: all drugs for hypertension's treatment
entry.name: antihypertensive drug

entry.description: class of medications
entry.name: anticonvulsant agent

entry.description: pharmaceutical or chemical fungicide or fungistatic used to treat and prevent mycosis
entry.name: antifungal

entry.description: substance used to treat or prevent parasitic infections
entry.name: antiparasitic

entry.description: substance that reduces or suppresses inflammation
entry.name: anti-inflammatory agent

entry.description: class of pharmaceuticals used in treatment of protozoan infection
entry.name: antiprotozoal

entry.description: drug that prevents or reduces fever by lowering the body temperature from a raised state
entry.name: antipyretic

entry.description: Agents that suppress cough. They act centrally on the medullary cough center. Expectorants, also used in the treatment of cough, act locally
entry.name: antitussive

entry.description: photosensitivity disorder in which an agent or allergen is activated by light to sensitize the allergic response
entry.name: photodermatitis

entry.description: Photoprotection is the biochemical process that helps organisms cope with molecular damage caused by sunlight
entry.name: Photoprotection

entry.description: class of pharmaceuticals that decrease platelet aggregation and inhibit thrombus formation
entry.name: platelet aggregation inhibitors

entry.description: category of pharmaceutical drugs
entry.name: Mast cell stabilizer

entry.description: topical skin product that helps protect against sunburn
entry.name: sunscreen

entry.description: molecule that inhibits the oxidation of other molecules
entry.name: antioxidant

entry.description: compound which inhibits or antagonizes the biosynthesis or actions of proteases (endopeptidases).
entry.name: protease inhibitor

entry.description: secreted or excreted chemical factor that triggers a social response in members of the same species
entry.name: pheromone

entry.description: drugs used to relieve pain
entry.name: analgesic

entry.description: chemical used to kill unwanted plants
entry.name: herbicide

entry.description: pesticide used against insects
entry.name: insecticide

entry.description: type of antigen that produces an abnormally vigorous immune response, in which the immune system reacts to fight off a perceived threat that would otherwise be harmless to the body
entry.name: allergen

entry.description: any substance, radionuclide, or radiation that promotes carcinogenesis, the formation of cancer
entry.name: carcinogen

entry.description: chemical compound used to oxidize another substance
entry.name: oxidizing agent

entry.description: chemical compound
entry.name: adenosine

entry.description: interorganismal phenomenon in biogeocenosis
entry.name: allelopathy

entry.description: pesticide used to kill fungi
entry.name: fungicide

entry.description: agent that causes hallucinations, perception anomalies, and other substantial subjective changes in thoughts, emotion, and consciousness
entry.name: hallucinogen

entry.description: substance that promotes the production of urine
entry.name: diuretic

entry.description: chemical family
entry.name: barbiturates

entry.description: agents that increase energy expenditure and weight loss by neural and chemical regulation
entry.name: anti-obesity medication

entry.description: drugs that inhibit acetylcholinesterase
entry.name: acetylcholinesterase inhibitor

entry.description: herbs which stimulate blood flow in the pelvic area and uterus; some stimulate menstruation
entry.name: Emmenagogue

entry.description: Miscellaneous agents found useful in the symptomatic treatment of diarrhea. They have no effect on the agent(s) that cause diarrhea, but merely alleviate the condition
entry.name: antidiarrhoeal

entry.description: drug, usually applied topically, that relieves pruritus (itching)
entry.name: antipruritic

entry.description: drugs or chemicals which irradicate the infestation of human head lice
entry.name: Pediculicide

entry.description: Reproductive toxicity is a hazard associated with some chemical substances, which interfere in some way with normal reproduction; such substances are called reprotoxic.
entry.name: reproductive toxicity

entry.description: substance for topical application that produces redness of the skin
entry.name: rubefacient

entry.description: A drug or substance that increases the flow rate of saliva.
entry.name: Sialogogue

entry.description: A virucide is any physical or chemical agent that deactivates or destroys viruses. This differs from an antiviral drug, which inhibits the proliferation of the virus.
entry.name: Virucide

entry.description: lightening of the skin or loss of pigment
entry.name: depigmentation

entry.description: Agents that are used to stimulate evacuation of the bowels
entry.name: Cathartic

entry.description: toxic effect by a compound on plant growth. An agent poisonous to plants, having a toxic effect on plant growth.
entry.name: phytotoxicity

entry.description: Hepatoprotection or antihepatotoxicity is the ability of a chemical substance to prevent damage to the liver
entry.name: Hepatoprotection

entry.description: Prooxidants are chemicals that induce oxidative stress, either by generating reactive oxygen species or by inhibiting antioxidant systems.
entry.name: Pro-oxidant

entry.description: route through which substances may be received
entry.name: skin absorption

entry.description: Agents which are destructive to amebae, especially the parasitic species causing amebiasis in man and animal
entry.name: Amebicide

entry.description: Ascaricides are drugs to treat ascariasis that is caused by infections with parasitic nematodes (roundworms) of the genus Ascaris (giant intestinal roundworms).
entry.name: Ascaricide

entry.description: drug that causes anesthesia
entry.name: anesthetic

entry.description: substance that acts in the brain stem or spinal cord to produce tonic or clonic convulsions, often by removing normal inhibitory tone
entry.name: convulsant

entry.description: a disorder of the cells lining the inside of a hair follicle
entry.name: Hyperkeratinization

entry.description: Agents that are put on the skin to reduce sweating or prevent excess sweating (hyperhidrosis)
entry.name: Antiperspirants

entry.description: A substance causing the halt in the production of sebum (sebostasis) by the sebaceous glands.
entry.name: Sebostatic

entry.description: drug that induces vomiting
entry.name: emetic

entry.description: substance that acts locally on cutaneous or mucosal surfaces to produce inflammation
entry.name: irritant

entry.description: group of chemical compounds
entry.name: antineoplastic

entry.description: medicine or chemical compound that inhibits or blocks prostaglandin
entry.name: antiprostaglandin

entry.description: preparation to induce evacuation of the bowels. produces a soft formed stool, and relaxes and loosens the bowels, typically used over a protracted period, to relieve constipation.
entry.name: purgative

entry.description: drug used to cause dilation of the blood vessels
entry.name: vasodilator agent

entry.description: An agent that promotes healing through the formation of scar tissue. For example, sandalwood is a natural cicatrizant.
entry.name: Cicatrizant

entry.description: medication or chemical compound that treats neuralgia
entry.name: antineuralgic

entry.description: Functions to control the survival, growth, differentiation and effector function of tissues and cells.
entry.name: cytokine activity

entry.description: the property of chemical agents that damages the genetic information within a cell causing mutations, which may lead to cancer
entry.name: genotoxicity

entry.description: A substance that counteracts hair loss.
entry.name: anti alopecic

entry.description: The stopping, prevention or reduction of the activity of the enzyme ornithine decarboxylase. Ornithine decarboxylase antizyme (ODC-AZ) is an ornithine decarboxylase inhibitor.
entry.name: ornithine decarboxylase inhibitor activity

entry.description: class of drugs used to treat or ameliorate peptic ulcer or irritation of the gastrointestinal tract
entry.name: anti-ulcer drug

entry.description: substance that prevents infectious agents or organisms from spreading or kill infectious agents in order to prevent the spread of infection
entry.name: anti-infective agent

entry.description: Non-steroidal chemical compounds with abortifacient activity.
entry.name: Abortifacient Agents, Nonsteroidal

entry.description: An agent that kills Trichomonas organisms, such as in treating vaginitis that is caused by Trichomonas vaginalis.
entry.name: antitrichomonal agents

entry.description: Drugs that stimulate contraction of the myometrium. They are used to induce labor, obstetric at term, to prevent or control postpartum or postabortion hemorrhage, and to assess fetal status in high risk pregnancies.
entry.name: oxytocics

entry.description: Agents that are used to treat allergic reactions. Most of these drugs act by preventing the release of inflammatory mediators or inhibiting the actions of released mediators on their target cells. (from ama drug evaluations annual, 1994, p475)
entry.name: Anti-Allergic Agents

entry.description: Drugs that are used to treat asthma
entry.name: Anti-Asthmatic Agents

entry.description: A biosynthetic precursor of collagen containing additional amino acid sequences at the amino-terminal and carboxyl-terminal ends of the polypeptide chains.
entry.name: Procollagen

entry.description: Allergent causing anaphylaxis, an allergic reaction with symptoms such as itchy rash, throat swelling, low blood pressure.
entry.name: anaphylactic
